Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Model

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.utils.Observable<ServerResponse>
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Model
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Model
extends Observable<ServerResponse>
implements java.lang.Cloneable
The model contains a battlefield and the info to let the game run properly It also has all the methods to change itself and to check if a move is valid or not

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Model()
    Create a new model and instance a new battlefield

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addGod​(GodCard god)
    Add a god to the god in game list
    void addPlayer​(Player player)
    It adds a player to the list of all players
    void askForPrometheus​(PlayerAction playerAction)
    When the controller receives a TOKEN_SELECTED if the owner has Prometheus, I ask him if he wants to use his power or not The token he wants to move is saved for his next answer
    java.util.List<Cell> askForValidBuilds​(PlayerAction playerAction)
    This is called by the controller just to check if the real player has given a correct value It works exactly like the validBuilds method
    java.util.List<Cell> askValidMoves​(PlayerAction playerAction)
    This is called by the controller just to check that the real player has given an appropriate input in the move phase It works exactly like the computeValidMoves but there is no need to check that there are no valid moves
    static void athenaMovedUp​(java.lang.Boolean trueOrFalse)
    Set the value for didAthenaMovedUp
    ServerResponse checkLoseForMove​(Token otherToken, java.util.List<Token> enemyTokens, GodCard myGodCard, java.util.List<GodCard> enemyGodCards, Token selectedToken)
    This method is called when I check the valid moves of a player If the return of that method is null I check if that player has lost the game or if he can move the other token If he lost it checks how many player there are If 2 the other one wins the game, if 3 this player is removed from the game
    boolean checkWin​(Token movedToken, GodCard myGodCard, java.util.List<GodCard> enemyGodCards)
    A player wins the game if he goes up from level 2 to level 3
    void clearBattlefield()
    Just for run multiple tests The battlefield is a singleton, so it is necessary to clear it before use it again
    void computeGodChoices​(PlayerAction playerAction)
    It parse the player action to get the chosen God, then that God is set to that player and removed from the allGodCards list After this if the list is empty it is started the routine for let players place their tokens and the allGodCards list is re-created If not then it is asked to the next player what God he wants
    java.util.List<Cell> computeValidMoves​(Token selectedToken, Token otherToken, java.util.List<Token> enemyTokens, GodCard myGodCard, java.util.List<GodCard> enemyGodCards, Battlefield battlefield)
    Here there is the ad-hoc call for the computeValidMoves method It is based on the player-in-turn God card If that God card does not modify the move than it calls the default move More JavaDOC inside the ad-hoc method
    boolean differentCell​(Cell firstCell, Cell secondCell)
    Check if the two cells have different coordinates
    void disconnected​(java.lang.String name)
    When a player disconnected if there are 2 players the last one win the game, else he is removed from the game and the game goes on
    ServerResponse gameOver​(java.lang.String winner)
    This method creates a GAME OVER message because someone won the game
    java.util.List<Player> getAllPlayers()  
    Battlefield getBattlefield()  
    ModelUtils getCopy()
    It returns a partial copy of the model It contains the battlefield ready to be printed, the turn and the player

    TokenColor getTurn()  
    java.util.List<Cell> getValidCells()
    It is used in test to get the valid cells to print It return the value and delete it
    static boolean isAthenaMovedUp()  
    boolean isPlayerTurn​(Player player)
    Compare the current turn with a player's color if they match then it is that player's turn
    static boolean isPrometheusUsePower()  
    void notifyWrongInput()
    It is called by the controller to notify the player-in-turn that he inserted a wrong or a non expected input
    boolean notPerimeterCell​(Cell targetCell)
    Check if the targetCell is a perimeter cell
    Token parseToken​(int tokenId)  
    void performBuild​(PlayerAction playerAction)
    It calls the incrementHeight on the cell that a player has chosen to build After a build has been made, the turn is updated
    void performMove​(PlayerAction playerAction)
    Here is where the move is parsed for ad-hoc method The check for the legal move is made by the controller After a player has moved his token, that token is checked for the win condition If true a message is sent to the client, if not the game continue normally
    void placeToken​(PlayerAction playerAction)
    Check if the message is correct, if not it is requested the same to the same player If it is, then if the same player has another token to place it is requested the same thing to that player, else it checks if all the player have placed their tokens.
    ServerResponse playerLost​(Player looser)
    This method removes a player from the game because there are 3 player and one lost
    void prometheusFirstBuild()
    If Prometheus want to use his power he has to make a build as a first action Than all parameters are updated to let prometheus build, move not going up and build again
    static void prometheusUsePower​(java.lang.Boolean trueOrFalse)
    Set the value of prometheusUsePower
    void removeFromTheGame​(Player player)
    It removes a player from the game and set free the cells where he has his tokens
    void setBattlefield​(Battlefield battlefield)
    It is used in test to set a custom battlefield
    void setPrometheusToken​(Token token)
    Used in test
    void setTurn​(TokenColor turn)
    Set a new color for the turn
    void updateTurn()
    It updates the current turn if it is red than it updates to blue if it is blue it checks the number of players.
    java.util.List<Cell> validBuilds​(Token selectedToken, Token otherToken, java.util.List<Token> enemyTokens, GodCard myGodCard, java.util.List<GodCard> enemyGodCards, Battlefield battlefield)
    It parses the input to get the correct method based on the God card A player CAN build around the token he moved A token can NOT build out of the battlefield, where there is a token (himself too), where there is a dome More detailed JavaDoc into each ad-hoc methods
    void validMoves​(PlayerAction playerAction)
    It calculates the valid moves that a player can make A token CAN move one Cell around himself A token can NOT move out of the battlefield, where there is another token (himself too), on a build higher than 1 of it's own, where there is a dome This takes all the values needed for call the properly method based on the God card and and call the methods passing it all the parameters

    addObserver, notify, removeObserver

    • isPlayerTurn

      public boolean isPlayerTurn​(Player player)
      Compare the current turn with a player's color if they match then it is that player's turn
      Parameters:
      player - the player to ask for color
      Returns:
      true if it is it's turn, false otherwise

      Returns:
      modelCopy

    • computeGodChoices

      public void computeGodChoices​(PlayerAction playerAction) throws java.io.IOException
      It parse the player action to get the chosen God, then that God is set to that player and removed from the allGodCards list After this if the list is empty it is started the routine for let players place their tokens and the allGodCards list is re-created If not then it is asked to the next player what God he wants
      Parameters:
      playerAction - the action to parse in order to get the name of the chosen God
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • placeToken

      public void placeToken​(PlayerAction playerAction) throws java.io.IOException
      Check if the message is correct, if not it is requested the same to the same player If it is, then if the same player has another token to place it is requested the same thing to that player, else it checks if all the player have placed their tokens. If so then the game can start, else it requests the same thing to the next player
      Parameters:
      playerAction - package message with all the info
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • validMoves

      public void validMoves​(PlayerAction playerAction) throws java.io.IOException
      It calculates the valid moves that a player can make A token CAN move one Cell around himself A token can NOT move out of the battlefield, where there is another token (himself too), on a build higher than 1 of it's own, where there is a dome This takes all the values needed for call the properly method based on the God card and and call the methods passing it all the parameters
      Parameters:
      playerAction - the message from the observer that contains all the information
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • askForPrometheus

      public void askForPrometheus​(PlayerAction playerAction) throws java.io.IOException
      When the controller receives a TOKEN_SELECTED if the owner has Prometheus, I ask him if he wants to use his power or not The token he wants to move is saved for his next answer
      Parameters:
      playerAction - the packet with all the info
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • prometheusFirstBuild

      public void prometheusFirstBuild() throws java.io.IOException
      If Prometheus want to use his power he has to make a build as a first action Than all parameters are updated to let prometheus build, move not going up and build again
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • getTokens

      public java.util.List<Token> getTokens​(java.util.List<Player> players)
      Parameters:
      players - a list of players
      Returns:
      all the tokens of those players

    • getGodCards

      public java.util.List<GodCard> getGodCards​(java.util.List<Player> players)
      Parameters:
      players - a list of players
      Returns:
      a list of all those players God cards

    • parseToken

      public Token parseToken​(int tokenId)
      Parameters:
      tokenId - a unique identifier of a token
      Returns:
      the token who is associated with that token id. Null if there is no token with that id

    • computeValidMoves

      public java.util.List<Cell> computeValidMoves​(Token selectedToken, Token otherToken, java.util.List<Token> enemyTokens, GodCard myGodCard, java.util.List<GodCard> enemyGodCards, Battlefield battlefield)
      Here there is the ad-hoc call for the computeValidMoves method It is based on the player-in-turn God card If that God card does not modify the move than it calls the default move More JavaDOC inside the ad-hoc method

    • askValidMoves

      public java.util.List<Cell> askValidMoves​(PlayerAction playerAction)
      This is called by the controller just to check that the real player has given an appropriate input in the move phase It works exactly like the computeValidMoves but there is no need to check that there are no valid moves
      Parameters:
      playerAction - the last action made bu a player

    • checkLoseForMove

      public ServerResponse checkLoseForMove​(Token otherToken, java.util.List<Token> enemyTokens, GodCard myGodCard, java.util.List<GodCard> enemyGodCards, Token selectedToken)
      This method is called when I check the valid moves of a player If the return of that method is null I check if that player has lost the game or if he can move the other token If he lost it checks how many player there are If 2 the other one wins the game, if 3 this player is removed from the game
      Parameters:
      otherToken - other players in turn token
      enemyTokens - enemy tokens on the battlefield
      myGodCard - player in turn god card
      enemyGodCards - enemies god cards
      selectedToken - the token player in turn selected
      Returns:
      the correct ServerResponse to let the game routine run properly It could be a TOKEN_NOT_MOVABLE, GAME_OVER or PLAYER_LOST

    • performMove

      public void performMove​(PlayerAction playerAction) throws java.io.IOException
      Here is where the move is parsed for ad-hoc method The check for the legal move is made by the controller After a player has moved his token, that token is checked for the win condition If true a message is sent to the client, if not the game continue normally
      Parameters:
      playerAction - the message from the observer that contain all the information
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • getOtherToken

      public Token getOtherToken​(int firstTokenID)
      Parameters:
      firstTokenID - unique integer of a token
      Returns:
      the other token of the player who own the token with the ID in the parameter

    • validBuilds

      public java.util.List<Cell> validBuilds​(Token selectedToken, Token otherToken, java.util.List<Token> enemyTokens, GodCard myGodCard, java.util.List<GodCard> enemyGodCards, Battlefield battlefield)
      It parses the input to get the correct method based on the God card A player CAN build around the token he moved A token can NOT build out of the battlefield, where there is a token (himself too), where there is a dome More detailed JavaDoc into each ad-hoc methods
      Returns:
      a List of Cell in which the token just moved can build

    • askForValidBuilds

      public java.util.List<Cell> askForValidBuilds​(PlayerAction playerAction)
      This is called by the controller just to check if the real player has given a correct value It works exactly like the validBuilds method
      Parameters:
      playerAction - the message from the observer that contain all the information
      Returns:
      a list of Cell in which a player can build

    • performBuild

      public void performBuild​(PlayerAction playerAction) throws java.io.IOException
      It calls the incrementHeight on the cell that a player has chosen to build After a build has been made, the turn is updated
      Parameters:
      playerAction - the message from the observer that contains all the information
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • checkWin

      public boolean checkWin​(Token movedToken, GodCard myGodCard, java.util.List<GodCard> enemyGodCards)
      A player wins the game if he goes up from level 2 to level 3
      Parameters:
      movedToken - the token to be checked to verify the win condition
      Returns:
      true if the token's owner wins, false else.

    • gameOver

      public ServerResponse gameOver​(java.lang.String winner)
      This method creates a GAME OVER message because someone won the game
      Parameters:
      winner - the player who win
      Returns:
      the correct ServerResponse

    • playerLost

      public ServerResponse playerLost​(Player looser)
      This method removes a player from the game because there are 3 player and one lost
      Parameters:
      looser - is the player who lost
      Returns:
      the correct ServerResponse

    • removeFromTheGame

      public void removeFromTheGame​(Player player)
      It removes a player from the game and set free the cells where he has his tokens
      Parameters:
      player - the player who has to be removed

    • updateTurn

      public void updateTurn()
      It updates the current turn if it is red than it updates to blue if it is blue it checks the number of players. If 2 than it is red again if it is 3 it changes to yellow if it is yellow it updates to red

    • notifyWrongInput

      public void notifyWrongInput() throws java.io.IOException
      It is called by the controller to notify the player-in-turn that he inserted a wrong or a non expected input
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • differentCell

      public boolean differentCell​(Cell firstCell, Cell secondCell)
      Check if the two cells have different coordinates
      Parameters:
      firstCell - one of the two cells
      secondCell - second of the two cells

    • notPerimeterCell

      public boolean notPerimeterCell​(Cell targetCell)
      Check if the targetCell is a perimeter cell
      Parameters:
      targetCell - the cell to check for

    • disconnected

      public void disconnected​(java.lang.String name) throws java.io.IOException
      When a player disconnected if there are 2 players the last one win the game, else he is removed from the game and the game goes on
      Parameters:
      name - name of the player who disconnect
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if can't send object into the socket

    • clearBattlefield

      public void clearBattlefield()
      Just for run multiple tests The battlefield is a singleton, so it is necessary to clear it before use it again
